great to see some old pics from the early days of New Zealand, most people don't even know where we are, let alone that we have some sort of civilisation here, grin.

comment.author: 27812488@N00
comment._content: A superb historical scene. I wondered if this was Rev. William Williams who was still remembered in Napier when I was a boy through his fame as a translator of the Bible into Maori. However it seems he was not that Williams (Napier seemed full of Williams's) but he worked on the Railway. What a skillful stereoscopist. What a fantastic image set!

comment.author: 32741315@N06
comment._content:
Hi kiwizone

You're right - New Zealand seems full of William Williamses! Really glad you're enjoying these stereographs.

--Courtney
comment.authorname: National Library NZ on The Commons
